results.title: Barchester Chronicles
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Powell, BBC and David Giles
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Anthony Trollope’s two 19th Century classics, “The Warden”, and “Barchester Towers”, starring Donald Pleasence, Nigel Hawthorne, Geraldine McEwan and Susan Hampshire. Reverend Septimus Harding is one of the most respected men in Barchester. He lives an honest and undisturbed life until the advent of a passionate reformer, John Bold, who accuses the Reverend of corruption which turns his cosy world of Barchester upside down.

results.title: Barcelona Chair
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Design Classic Series”.
The Barcelona Chair was designed by the great German architect and designer Mies van de Rohe for the German pavilion at the Great Barcelona Exhibition of 1929. Using chrome and leather, he refined the design to the simplest elements of pure form, creating a cult object for those who can afford it.

results.title: Barcelona
results.brief_description: A practical guide for travellers intending to visit the Catalonian region of Spain. Beginning in Barcelona, host John Guerrasio provides information about public transport options, accommodation, food and currency. He visits the 1992 Olympic precinct, the Joan Miro Gallery situated on Monjuic and the Ramblas. From Barcelona, he travels to Montserrat, Tarragona, the Costa Brava and Gerona highlighting the main areas of cultural and geographic interest. Also includes a visit to Antonio Gaudi’s Sagrada Familia.

results.title: Barbed wire and mandolins
results.creator_credit: Sam Grana, Nicola Zaraglia and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When Italy became an active player in the Second World War in 1940, the Canadian government began to fear the Italian community within Canada as a threat to national security. The action they took was to use the Canadian Mounted Police Force to contain alleged facist sympathizers. Seven hundred of the accused sympathizers were held in internment camps for up to three years. The majority of detainees were held at Petawawa, Ontario. Through interviewing Italian-Canadians who were affected by these actions, one discovers that there was a spirit of camaraderie and hope amongst those at Petawawa as the internees coped with their situation in the any way they could, such as through music, art and gardening. Despite these diversions, what they have lost financially and socially in the community remains with them forever.

results.title: Barbarian diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Peter Minns, BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Chris Patten’s east and west”.
First of the three part documentary series “Chris Patten’s East and West” written and presented by the former British governor of Hong Kong, Chris Patten. In this episode Patten focuses on China - socially, economically and politically - from its past history to the China of the 90s. He more specifically deals with human rights and economic reform emphasising his strong belief that it is important “to keep trade and human rights separate” and that “economical reform requires political reform”. The program covers President Nixon’s visit and his meeting with Mao Tse-tung in 1972; the US/China alliance and lifting of trade restrictions; the rise of Deng Xaioping and the reform movement following Mao’s death; the Tiananmen Square massacre of 1989; international and trade relations at the expense of human rights recognition; President Clinton’s visit in 1998. Also briefly looks at human rights issues in Burma through an interview with the Burmese Opposition Leader, Aung San Suu Kyi who has been politically isolated under house arrest for over 9 years, followed by a comparison to Taiwan, a mainly Chinese capitalist society, democratic and free and a thorn in China’s side. Includes interviews with Henry Kissinger (US National Security Adviser 1969-75), Paul Wolfowitz (US Assistant Secretary of State, Asia 1982-86), Winston Lord (US Foreign Policy Adviser 1970-73) and Sir Alan Donald (British Ambassador, Beijing 1988-91) among others. Contains b&w archival footage and stills.

results.title: Bapteme
results.creator_credit: Louis Wipf, Eric Trotta and Rene Feret
results.brief_description:
In 1935, near Bethune (northern France), Aline marries Pierre instead of the man who had been chosen for her. After their honeymoon, Aline replaces her mother running a small cafe while Pierre works on fairs and markets. Largely inspired by the real story of his parents, Rene Feret’s film chronicles the ups and downs of a working class couple from the 1930’s to the 1960’s.

Credits: Producers, Eric Trotta, Louis Wipf ; director, Rene Feret ; writer, Rene Feret ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Frederic Chopin, Evelyne Stroh.
Cast: Valerie Stroh, Jean-Yves Berteloot, Jacques Bonnaffe, Pierre-Alain Chapuis, Edith Scob, Elsa Zylberstein.

results.title: Bantu tribes of Southern Africa
results.creator_credit: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the old ways of life among the Zulu, Xhosa, Swazi, Ndebele, Sotho and Venda tribes. These various Bantu groups are now being brought into the South African industrial community. Outlines the ways in which this movement is changing the culture of the tribes and the struggle to preserve some of the old ways.

results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and James Murray

results.title: Bannerfilm
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: Norman Laliberte, one of the most creative designers of banners in North America is shown in his workroom piecing, stitching together, from pieces of varicoloured fabric, figures and symbols reminiscent of ancient pomp and pageantry. Music and movement are used in the film to heighten the effect of the arrangement shaping and growing before your eyes.
